results.title: Like it is
results.creator_credit: Chris Begley, George Nevile, John Brawley and Tony D'Aquino
results.brief_description: When an elderly women is forced to have her beloved budgie put down, a vet’s assistant is disturbed by his employer’s unscrupulous practices. A touching short film about human compassion. Cast includes Dylan Lewis, Frank Gallacher and Dawn Klingberg.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Chris Begley, George Nevile, John Brawley and Tony D’Aquino

results.title: Like drowning
results.creator_credit: Victorian College of the Arts, School of Film and Television, Robert Stephenson, Ann Shenfield, Paul Fletcher and Cath Murphy
results.brief_description: A moving animated tale about a young family who try to come to terms with the sudden death of one of the children through drowning. The family struggles to cope and adopt drastic changes in their lifestyle in order to come to terms with the ordeal.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Victorian College of the Arts, School of Film and Television, Robert Stephenson, Ann Shenfield, Paul Fletcher and Cath Murphy

results.title: Like drowning
results.brief_description: The story of a little boy’s grief for his mother delicately etched into clay. This simply charming film explores the grief that a young boy, Billy, experiences after losing his mother. All he wants is her back.

results.title: Like any child only more so (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: University of California, Los Angeles, Maile Ornellas and Catherine Allan
results.brief_description: Discusses hyperactivity in children. Looks at the definition of hyperactivity, its many possible causes, and methods of treatment. Treatment can include family counselling, special school programs, diets and the use of stimulant like drugs.

results.title: Like any child
results.creator_credit: Cradle Mountain Film Productions for Department of Health and Community Services Specialist Children's Services Unit and The Brotherhood of St Laurence and Gordon Glenn
results.brief_description: Profiles a day in the professional life of two early childhood educators as they include a child with a disability in their centre. We follow their daily routine; seeing how they create a positive environment to encourage interaction between the children and how thoughtful planning enables all children to participate in the program. Accompanied by 3p. Discussion Notes and 47p. training manual entitled “Like any child: planning for children with disabilities.”
results.creator_credit_for_label: Cradle Mountain Film Productions for Department of Health and Community Services Specialist Children’s Services Unit and The Brotherhood of St Laurence and Gordon Glenn

group.title: 2004 New visual cultures: online [Selection of works]

results.title: Lights, camera, action: Supergeek (August 2006)
results.brief_description: In this story the ACMI Screen Pit becomes a Sunridge High classroom. Oscar from Short Cuts is auditioning for roles in his latest film ‘Super Geek 2’. He tries to get the Short Cuts kids to do it but has no luck, so he turns to the ‘new class’ for help. Produced in Melbourne and screened on the Seven Network, Short Cuts is a terrific local TV series set in a Year 9 Media Studies class. Short Cuts’ stories explore how the video camera can be a tool of expression, exploration and communication - and also of manipulation, secrecy and lies. Slowly, the characters find ways of using the camera and in the process, find out more about themselves, each other, their friends, their families and the world.

results.title: Lights, action, Africa!
results.creator_credit: Alan Root, Survival Anglia Ltd and Harry Aldous
results.brief_description: Two of the most famous African wildlife filmmakers, Joan and Alan Root show the excitement and danger involved in filming wild animals. Spitting cobras, galloping herds of animals and nervous hippos all make this film a tribute to the courage and genius of the Roots.

results.title: Lights that never fail
results.brief_description: At an international conference in London, men of many nations are seen as they meet to discuss the problems of safeguarding life at sea. The film then shows the work of the men who keep the lighthouses, and how their faithful attention to duty protects people of different countries and of all races.
